articles.title: Greetings to President of South Africa
articles.content:
Greetings to President of South Africa
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma, president of the Republic of South Africa, on the occasion of the freedom day, its national day.
					 The message sincerely wished the president and people of South Africa greater achievements in their work for the stability and prosperity of the country.
					
					 It expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the common interests.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Sierra Leone
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Sierra Leone
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Ernest Bai Koroma, president of the Republic of Sierra Leone, on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message sincerely wished the president and people of Sierra Leone achievements in their efforts to achieve peace, stability and socio-economic development of the country, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the mutual interests.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Nepalese Government, Bereaved Families of Victims
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Nepalese Government, Bereaved Families of Victims
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of sympathy to Ram Baran Yadav, president of Nepal, in connection with the recent earthquake that hit Nepal, claming huge casualties and material losses.
					 The message expressed deep condolences and sympathy to the Nepalese government and bereaved families of the victims.
					
					 It wished the Nepalese government and people success in the efforts to eradicate the aftermath of the quake at an early date and bring the living of the people in the afflicted area to normal.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Nepalese FM
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Nepalese FM
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Monday sent a message of sympathy to his Nepalese counterpart Mahendra Bahadur Pandey in connection with the earthquake that hit Nepal, claming huge casualties and material losses.
					 Expressing deep sympathy to him and the bereaved families of the victims, the message wished the Nepalese government success in its efforts to eradicate the aftermath of the disaster as early as possible and bring the living of the people in the afflicted area to normal.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Surveys of Chemical Complex, Coal Mine
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Surveys of Chemical Complex, Coal Mine
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Sunchon Chemical Complex.
					 The premier went round the paint production building and the equipment assembling shop to learn in detail about the building and their production capacity.
					
					 He underlined the need to produce paint locally, develop new varieties of paint to increase economic efficiency and bring earlier the commissioning of the paint production process.
					
					 He learned about coal deposit, quantity of coal mined and progress made in the construction of drain pit at the February 8 Jikdong Youth Coal Mine before having a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issues of producing and supplying under plan spare parts needed for normal operation of transport system as required by the newly laid belt conveyor and satisfactorily supplying major equipment and materials to coal mines to boost the coal production.
					
					 Earlier, the premier made a field survey of the work for turning Pyongyang City into parks. He underscored the need to carry out afforestation and greening under a long-term plan, plant more trees of good species to suit environment and take measures for taking care of them regularly.

articles.title: DPRK Vice-Premier Meets Russian Government Economic Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK Vice-Premier Meets Russian Government Economic Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, met and had a friendly talk with the government economic delegation of the Russian Federation headed by Alexandr Galushka, minister of Development of Far East who is chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia Inter-governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology, which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Minister of Development of Far East of Russia
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Minister of Development of Far East of Russia
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the visiting minister of Development of Far East of Russia.
					 The gift was handed to DPRK Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol on Monday by Minister of Development of Far East of Russia Alexandr Galushka who is chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia Inter-governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade and Economy, Science and Technology.
					
					 A gift to Kim Jong Un from the Rus Gidro Company of Russia was handed by its General Manager Yevgeni Dod.

articles.title: IPU Secretary General Here
articles.content:
IPU Secretary General Here
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Secretary General of the Inter-Parliamentary Union Martin Chungong and his party arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Protocol Signed between DPRK and Russian Governments
articles.content:
Protocol Signed between DPRK and Russian Governments
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The protocol of the 7th meeting of the DPRK-Russia InterÔºçGovernmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade and Economy, Science and Technology was signed at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
					 Present there were Minister of External Economic Relations Ri Ryong Nam who doubles as chairman of the DPRK side to the DPRK-Russia Inter-governmental Committee, officials concerned, Minister of Development of Far East of Russia Alexandr Galushka who doubles as chairman of the Russian side to the Inter-governmental Committee, his party of the Russian government economic delegation and Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 The protocol was inked by Ri Ryong Nam and Alexandr Galushka.

articles.title: DPRK-Russia Inter-governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade and Economy, Science and Technology Meets
articles.content:
DPRK-Russia Inter-governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade and Economy, Science and Technology Meets
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The 7th meeting of the DPRK-Russia Inter-governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade and Economy, Science and Technology took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
					 Present there were Minister of External Economic Relations Ri Ryong Nam who doubles as chairman of the DPRK side to the Inter-governmental Committee, officials concerned, Minister of Development of Far East of Russia Alexandr Galushka who doubles as chairman of the Russian side to the Inter-governmental Committee, his party of the Russian government economic delegation and Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK. 
					
					 They discussed the issues of boosting the cooperation in trade, economy, science and technology between the two countries.
					
					 Earlier, the DPRK side to the DPRK-Russia Inter-governmental Committee hosted a reception at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel in honor of the Russian government economic delegation.

articles.title: Russian Government Economic Delegation Departs Here
articles.content:
Russian Government Economic Delegation Departs Here
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The government economic delegation of the Russian Federation headed by Alexandr Galushka, minister of Development of Far East who is chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia Inter-governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology, departed here on Monday after attending its 7th meeting.

articles.title: Park of Waterworks and Flowers under Construction
articles.content:
Park of Waterworks and Flowers under Construction
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- A project for building a park of large-size waterworks and flowers is nearing completion in Pyongyang.
					 Now it has been pushed forward to assemble the large-size fountains, build resting sites, plant flowers and turf and pave the park with granite.
					
					 The park will add beauty to scenic Pyongyang City.
					
					 An increasing number of citizens have volunteered themselves to work for its completion.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Develop Traditional Costumes
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Develop Traditional Costumes
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea is striving to develop the national costumes in line with the requirements of the times and modern aesthetic sense.
					 Many tailor shops in the country concentrate efforts on the making of Korean dresses and taking the lead in this work is Sinuiju City, North Phyongan Province.
					
					 Those tailor shops in the city have worked hard to preserve the peculiarities of traditional costumes through technical course, experience-sharing meeting and prize contest on the making of Korean dresses.
					
					Among them are Chongsong and Chaeha Korean tailor shops well-known for their high technique of making traditional costumes.
					
					 Kim Kum Sil, chief of the Chaeha Korean Tailor Shop, told KCNA that all the employees of the shop would strive to steadily improve their skills of making various kinds of traditional costumes.

articles.title: Halt to U.S. and Japanese Ambition for Aggression Called for
articles.content:
Halt to U.S. and Japanese Ambition for Aggression Called for
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held a press conference outside the puppet Ministry of Defense on April 21 at which it demanded the puppet authorities hold in check the U.S. and Japanese ambitions for hegemony.
					 It recalled that the U.S. and Japan pushed forward the revision of "the Japan-U.S. defence cooperation guidelines" in a bid to help the latter exercise "right to collective self-defense" and are mulling finally confirming it on April 27.
					
					 The guidelines pose a serious threat to the peace on the Korean peninsula and security of the nation as the peninsula is regarded as the top priority target of Japan's exercise of "right to collective self-defense", the organization noted, and continued:
					
					 The above-said moves are aimed to justify Japan's conversion into a military giant and its overseas aggression and serve the U.S. purpose of military hegemony.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korea Chiefly Responsible for Nuclear Threat: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korea Chiefly Responsible for Nuclear Threat: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean regime agreed to form the "Deterrence Strategy Committee" at the 7th KIDD meeting held in Washington on April 14.
					 As a result, the U.S.-south Korea "Extended Deterrence Policy Committee" and "Committee for Coping with Missiles" aimed at carrying out "tailored deterrence strategy" have merged into the "Deterrence Strategy Committee".
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean warmongers blustered at the recent meeting that they would elaborate on "4D operation concept" and round off it as OPLAN.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun says on Monday:
					
					 This is an extremely dangerous reckless action to complete the structure for a preemptive nuclear attack under the pretext of the fictitious "nuclear and missile threats" from the DPRK and ignite a nuclear war against it at any cost.
					
					 The substantial threat to the Korean peninsula is the threat of a nuclear war posed by the U.S. and south Korean regime to the DPRK. 
					
					 It is shameless, indeed, for the U.S. and south Korean regime to pull up the DPRK over its non-existent "nuclear and "missile threats." 
					
					 Their noisy trumpeting about those threats is nothing but a third-rate artifice to justify their moves to ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK and legalize the deployment of THAAD in south Korea, in particular.
					
					 Their attempt to launch a preemptive attack on the DPRK under the pretext of coping with the above-said threats is as foolish an act as jumping into fire with faggot on their back.
					
					 They would be well advised to bear in mind the warning of the DPRK and stop acting rashly.

articles.title: All-People Memorial Rally Held in Seoul
articles.content:
All-People Memorial Rally Held in Seoul
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- An all-people memorial rally took place in Seoul on April 25.
					 Present there were bereaved families of the ferry Sewol disaster, members of the All-People Measure Council for Ferry Sewol Disaster, the April 16 Family Consultative Council and other civic and public organizations and citizens, more than 5 000 in all.
					
					 Speakers demanded Park Geun Hye roll back the "enforcement ordinance" as regards the ferry Sewol disaster and take measures to find out those missing.
					
					 They said workers would join in the actions against the regime which sent more than 300 persons to the bottom of the sea and the regime exploiting workers.
					
					 Members of healthcare organizations branded the ferry disaster as the one caused by those who were seeking increased profits rather than caring for people's lives and security.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations of Poor and Disabled Support General Strike of KCTU
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations of Poor and Disabled Support General Strike of KCTU
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- South Korean organizations of the poor and disabled including the Solidarity for Liberation of the Poor, the Solidarity for Abolition of Discrimination against the Disabled and the Solidarity for the Poor Society held a press conference in Seoul on April 23 in support of the general strike of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU).
					 Speakers said the April 24 general strike of the KCTU is not a strike of the workers only but an action to settle the issues of the disabled, evacuees and all other people barely eking out their living on this land, their vital rights being trampled down.
					
					 They noted that they clearly saw through the Song Wan Jong case that the businesses paid politicians the money they collected from the workers by exploiting them and the political camp enabled the capitalists to exploit them unlimitedly through layoff and part-time job system. They declared the KCTU would carry on May Day and June actions with the April 24 general strike as a prelude.

articles.title: Actions for Vital Rights Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Vital Rights Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Anti-"government" actions for winning the vital rights were staged in different parts of south Korea on April 25 with at least 100 000 persons of more than 350 civic and public organizations including government employees, teachers, workers, peasants, the poor, youth, women and the disabled involved.
					 There took place a people's rally in Seoul to oppose the Park Geun Hye regime's moves to retrogressively revise pension. It was attended by more than 40 000 members of various organizations.
					
					 Speakers said the retrogressive revision of pension is the policy for privatizing pension which brings profits to the plutocrats only.
					
					 They called upon all organizations to fight against the regime's policy against welfare and the common people.
					
					 Similar rallies also took place in Pusan, Taegu and Kwangju that day.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Reflect on Japanese Imperialists' Colonial Rule and Aggression
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Reflect on Japanese Imperialists' Colonial Rule and Aggression
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore on April 22 carried an editorial denouncing Japan for not reflecting on the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and aggression in the past.
					 The editorial accused Japanese Prime Minister Abe of making reckless remarks evading Japan's responsibility for its history of aggression that day.
					
					 After taking his office Abe is attempting to distort history on the international arena, it said, adding such petty trick to cover the sky with his palms is intolerable.
					
					 During his appearance at a domestic broadcasting service of Japan on April 20, Abe negated the issue of using such words as aggression, apology, etc. in the prime minister's statement to be made on the occasion of 70 years since Japans' defeat, the editorial noted. 
					
					 There will be no future for Japan if it fails to properly settle its past, it said.

articles.title: National Consultative Meeting of Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture Held
articles.content:
National Consultative Meeting of Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture Held
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- A national consultative meeting of the Australia-DPRK Friendship and Culture took place in Sydney on Mar. 28.
					 Neil Fitzgerald, national chairman of the association, referred to the significance of the consultative meeting and introduced the successes made by the DPRK recently under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Noting that the U.S. has deployed huge forces on the Korean peninsula to create a constant danger while ratcheting up economic sanctions and blockade against the DPRK as part of its hostile policy toward the DPRK, he referred to the issue of promoting friendship with the Korean people and the issue of setting right the Australian public's wrong view on the DPRK.
					
					 Raymond Ferguson, national secretary of the association, recalled that the association has contributed to establishing the friendly relations between the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 Disclosing the absurdity of the reckless "human rights" campaign against the DPRK being kicked up by the U.S. and its allies, he said pursuant to such hostile policy, large-scale military drills against the DPRK are being staged on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 But the Korean people are not alone in their struggle, he said, adding that all friendship and solidarity organizations and the people aspiring after peace and reunification on the Korean peninsula are unequivocally supporting and encouraging the Korean people.
					
					 Then a resolution was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 It called on all progressive forces to get united and dynamically conduct the movement for solidarity with the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Conclusion Carried by Swedish Magazine
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Conclusion Carried by Swedish Magazine
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The detailed gist of the conclusion made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the enlarged meeting of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea on February 18 was carried by the Swedish magazine Korea Information on April 13.
					 It was illustrated with his photo.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Library Commemorated in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Library Commemorated in Bulgaria
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- A meeting for commemorating the 20th anniversary of the establishment of Kim Il Sung Library was held in Sofia on April 7.
					 Displayed at the venue of the meeting were photos dealing with the feats of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display were their works and photos showing successes made by the service personnel and people of the DPRK in the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Present there were personages of Kim Il Sung Library, the Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association, Juche idea followers. DPRK embassy officials were present on invitation.
					
					 The acting chief of Kim Il Sung Library made a report to be followed by speeches by Vasilka Nikiforova, chief of the library, and Simeon Ignatov, chairman of the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association.
					
					 They praised the President as the most outstanding great man in the 20th century who devoted himself to the freedom and independence of the country, prosperity of the country and happiness of its people, Korea's reunification and development of the world socialist cause. 
					
					 The library has made a positive contribution to widely disseminating the great Juche idea, Songun idea and promoting the friendship between the peoples of the two countries over the past two decades, they noted, adding:
					
					 The cause of Juche, Songun pioneered by the President is being successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the Korean people.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Observed by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Observed by Foreign Papers
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups illustrated with portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					 The April issue of the German paper Rote Fahne in an article titled "Eternal sun" said the President founded the Juche idea and ushered in a new era of independence when the popular masses are emerging masters of history, adding he is always alive in the hearts of humankind.
					
					 An Angolan paper on Apr. 10 in an article titled "Comrade Kim Il Sung, eternal President of the Korean people" illustrated with a photo of Kimilsungia said though he passed away, his idea and cause are always shining like the sun.
					
					 The Zambian paper Post on Apr. 11 in an article titled "President Kim Il Sung, eternal sun" noted that his august name means the sun and cited detailed facts to introduce his undying exploits and noble traits as the great man.
					
					 The April issue of the Bulgarian paper Iskra, praising his revolutionary career, said the Korean people are holding him in high esteem as the great father of the nation because he dedicated his precious life to the country and its people.
					
					 Introducing the advantages of Korean-style socialism centered on popular masses, the paper said the epoch-making successes made by the DPRK would be unthinkable without his august name.

articles.title: Appeal at Seminar of World Political Parties Supported by German Body
articles.content:
Appeal at Seminar of World Political Parties Supported by German Body
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany released a statement on Apr. 20 in support of the appeal made at the 19th seminar of world political parties on building new society.
					 The statement said:
					
					 2015 is a significant year that marks the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation.
					
					 It noted that President Kim Il Sung is the eternal leader of the WPK and the Korean people who achieved the historic cause of Korea's liberation, founded the WPK and led it to victories.
					
					 It said that leader Kim Jong Il is the eternal general secretary of the WPK who developed it into the party of Kim Il Sung and put the dignity and national power of socialist Korea on the highest level through his original Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the WPK, is the great leader of the WPK and the Korean people who has successfully carried forward the revolutionary idea and cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and led them to a victory, it said, and went on:
					
					 The WPK and the Korean people have dynamically advanced along the path of independence, Songun and socialism under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and turned out in a general discharge for glorifying this significant year as the one of great victories and grand revolutionary auspicious events.
					
					 The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany fully supports the appeal made at the seminar.

articles.title: Founding Anniversary of KPA Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Founding Anniversary of KPA Observed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- There took place a lecture in Benin, a lecture and book exhibition in Nigeria and a film show in Guinea from Apr. 20 to 22 to observe the 83rd founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 On display at the venue were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and books introducing the DPRK.
					
					 The chief of the Benin Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism referred to the history of the KPA which has always emerged victorious, being led by the great Songun brilliant commanders generation after generation.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy praised the Songun revolutionary leadership feats of Kim Jong Il and said the invincible might of socialist Korea has been further bolstered up by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The commander of the First Commando of Almami Samori Toure Barracks of the Guinean Army said the 83 year-long history of the KPA was a brilliant history in which it has always emerged victorious in the showdown with the U.S. and other hostile forces.

articles.title: KPA Founding Anniversary Observed by Guinean Body
articles.content:
KPA Founding Anniversary Observed by Guinean Body
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea released a bulletin on April 22 on the occasion of the 83rd anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The bulletin said in an article titled "Invincible KPA":
					
					April 25 this year marks the 83rd founding anniversary of the KPA.
					
					 The KPA has demonstrated its might as an invincible army that creditably guarantees the victory in the drive for defending socialism and building a thriving nation.
					
					 The KPA remains strong, first of all, in the aspect of its political and ideological might that no other army in the world can have or imitate.
					
					 Absolute trust in and loyalty to its supreme commander are its glorious tradition.
					
					 The KPA has emerged invincible thanks to the great army-people unity.
					
					 The people take care of the KPA soldiers as their real parents would do and render sincere assistance to them while the soldiers regard the people not only as their parents and brothers but as comrades-in-arms, revolutionary comrades and protect their lives and properties at the risk of their lives.
					
					 The KPA is also strong thanks to its tremendous military technical might.
					
					 The KPA has grown to be a matchless army as it is fully prepared for both attack and defence.
					
					 The service personnel of the KPA are fully determined to reunify the country and hasten the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche, united close around respected Supreme Commander HE Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia de Libertad de Sudafrica
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia de Libertad de Sudafrica 
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 27 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Sudafricana, Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma, con motivo del Dia de la Libertad, dia nacional del pais africano. 
					El remitente deseo de todo corazon mayores exitos en el trabajo del mandatario y pueblo sudafricanos por la estabilidad y la prosperidad del pais y expreso la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se ampliaran y se desarrollaran de acuerdo con los intereses comunes.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje al presidente de Sierra Leona
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje al presidente de Sierra Leona
						
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 27 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Sierra Leona, Ernest Bai Koroma, con motivo del 54o aniversario de la independencia del pais africano. 
					Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se ampliaran y se desarrollaran conforme a los intereses mutuos, el remitente desea de todo corazon al destinatario y a su pueblo exitos en los esfuerzos por la paz, la estabilidad y el desarrollo socioeconomico del pais.

articles.title: Premier coreano visita Complejo Quimico de Sunchon y Mina Carbonifera Juventud 8 de Febrero de Jikdong
articles.content:
Premier coreano visita Complejo Quimico de Sunchon y Mina Carbonifera Juventud 8 de Febrero de Jikdong
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, se cercioro en el terreno de las gestiones del Complejo Quimico de Sunchon.
					En el edificio de produccion de pintura y el taller de ensamblaje de equipos, averiguo en detalles la capacidad de ejecucion de obra y de produccion.
					
					Se abordaron los problemas tales como desarrollar nuevas pinturas produciendo las existentes con recursos nacionales para elevar la eficiencia economica y anticipar la inauguracion de la cadena de produccion de pinturas.
					
					En la Mina Carbonifera Juventud 8 de Febrero de Jikdong, el premier convoco una reunion de consulta tras averiguar la cantidad de yacimiento de carbon, la de carbon extraido y el estado de construccion de galeria de desague.
					
					Se debatieron las medidas para aumentar la produccion de carbon al suministrar en lo suficiente los equipos y materias primas principales.
					
					Anteriormente, el averiguo como marcha la creacion de areas verdes en la ciudad de Pyongyang y enfatizo la necesidad de crearlas con vistas al futuro al sembrar mas arboles de buena variedad y cuidarlos normalmente.

articles.title: Vicepremier coreano se reune con delegacion economica de Rusia
articles.content:
Vicepremier coreano se reune con delegacion economica de Rusia
						
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ACNC) -- El dia 27, el vicepremier coreano Ro Tu Chol departio en un ambiente amistoso en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion economica gubernamental de la Federacion Rusa encabezada por Alexandr Galushka, ministro de Desarrollo del Lejano Oriente y presidente de la parte rusa de la comision intergubernamental para la cooperacion en comercio, economia, ciencia y tecnica entre Corea y Rusia, que le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Rubricado protocolo de VII reunion de comision intergubernamental para cooperacion entre RPDC y Rusia
articles.content:
Rubricado protocolo de VII reunion de comision intergubernamental para cooperacion entre RPDC y Rusia
						
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 27 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae el protocolo de la VII reunion de la comision intergubernamental para la cooperacion en el comercio exterior, economia, ciencia y tecnica entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Federacion Rusa. 
					Participaron por la parte coreana, el ministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero y presidente de la parte coreana de comision mencionada, Ri Ryong Nam y otros funcionarios interesados, y por la rusa, los miembros de la delegacion economica del gobierno encabezada por el ministro de Desarrollo del Lejano Oriente y titular de la parte rusa de la misma comision, Alexandr Galushka y el embajador en Corea Alexandr Matsegora.
					
					Ri Ryong Nam y Alexandr Galushka firmaron el documento.

articles.title: VII reunion de comision intergubernamental para cooperacion entre RPDC y Rusia
articles.content:
VII reunion de comision intergubernamental para cooperacion entre RPDC y Rusia
						
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 27 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae la VII reunion de la comision intergubernamental para la cooperacion en el comercio exterior, economia, ciencia y tecnica entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Federacion Rusa.
					Participaron por la parte coreana el ministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero y presidente de la parte coreana de la comision mencionada, Ri Ryong Nam, y otros funcionarios, y por la rusa, los miembros de la delegacion economica gubernamental encabezada por el ministro de Desarrollo del Lejano Oriente y titular de la parte rusa de la misma comision, Alexandr Galushka y el embajador ruso en Corea Alexandr Matsegora.
					
					En la ocasion, fueron debatidos los asuntos de ampliar y desarrollar la cooperacion bilateral en el comercio, la economia, la ciencia y tecnica.
					
					Con anterioridad, la comision de la parte coreana ofrecio en el Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang un banquete en honor de la delegacion rusa.
